fr.xephi.authme.data.limbo

Class LimboService

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.xephi.authme.data.limbo.LimboService

  • public class LimboService
extends Object
    Service for managing players that are in "limbo," a temporary state players are put in which have joined but not yet logged in.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createLimboPlayer(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, boolean isRegistered)
      Creates a LimboPlayer for the given player and revokes all "limbo data" from the player.
      LimboPlayer getLimboPlayer(String name)
      Returns the limbo player for the given name, or null otherwise.
      boolean hasLimboPlayer(String name)
      Returns whether there is a limbo player for the given name.
      void muteMessageTask(org.bukkit.entity.Player player) 
      void replaceTasksAfterRegistration(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Creates new tasks for the given player and cancels the old ones for a newly registered player.
      void resetMessageTask(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, LimboMessageType messageType)
      Resets the message task associated with the player's LimboPlayer.
      void restoreData(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Restores the limbo data and subsequently deletes the entry.
      void unmuteMessageTask(org.bukkit.entity.Player player) 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • createLimboPlayer

        public void createLimboPlayer(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                              boolean isRegistered)
        Creates a LimboPlayer for the given player and revokes all "limbo data" from the player.
        Parameters:
        player - the player to process
        isRegistered - whether or not the player is registered

      • getLimboPlayer

        public LimboPlayer getLimboPlayer(String name)
        Returns the limbo player for the given name, or null otherwise.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to retrieve the data for
        Returns:
        the associated limbo player, or null if none available

      • hasLimboPlayer

        public boolean hasLimboPlayer(String name)
        Returns whether there is a limbo player for the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to check
        Returns:
        true if present, false otherwise

      • restoreData

        public void restoreData(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Restores the limbo data and subsequently deletes the entry.

        Note that teleportation on the player is performed by TeleportationService and changing the permission group is handled by AuthGroupHandler.

        Parameters:
        player - the player whose data should be restored

      • replaceTasksAfterRegistration

        public void replaceTasksAfterRegistration(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Creates new tasks for the given player and cancels the old ones for a newly registered player. This resets his time to log in (TimeoutTask) and updates the message he is shown (MessageTask).
        Parameters:
        player - the player to reset the tasks for

      • resetMessageTask

        public void resetMessageTask(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                             LimboMessageType messageType)
        Resets the message task associated with the player's LimboPlayer.
        Parameters:
        player - the player to set a new message task for
        messageType - the message to show for the limbo player

      • muteMessageTask

        public void muteMessageTask(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Parameters:
        player - the player whose message task should be muted

      • unmuteMessageTask

        public void unmuteMessageTask(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Parameters:
        player - the player whose message task should be unmuted
